intro: Lophiolepis calocephala, commonly known as the mountain everlasting, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its dense, compact growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in heads, giving it a distinctive appearance. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils in mountainous regions. Lophiolepis calocephala is known for its hardy nature and ability to thrive in arid conditions.
